p: The present study used Candida spp. reference strains C. albicans ATCC 60193, C. albicans ATCC 90029, C. krusei ATCC 34135, and C. tropicalis ATCC 750 from the American Type Culture Collection (ATCC) and C. albicans CBS 562 and C. tropicalis CBS 94 from the Centraalbureau voor Schimmelcultures (CBS). In addition, the following clinical strains were used, which were collected from the oral cavity, isolated, identified, and provided by the Laboratory of Clinical Mycology, Center of Health Sciences, Federal University of Para√≠ba: C. albicans LM01, C. albicans LM03, C. albicans LM04, C. tropicalis LM05, C. tropicalis LM07, and C. tropicalis LM08.
